title: Learn to Play D&D 5E
description: Spend a few hours learning how to play 5E D&D!

title: D&D with DM Jonathan, Zack and Stephen
description: Come play D&D! Various times & DM styles scheduled for the entire weekend! Kid Fridayendly tables available.

title: Crunchyroll
description: Playing episodes of random anime shows. Also accepting entries for anime drawing contest. Hand draw, digital and paintings.

title: Gaming
description: Underground Games will host single elimination revolving tournaments every 1.5 hours w/ prizes for Pokémon, Yugioh, Magic and Dragon Ball Super all weekend. The first entry is free, and subsequent entries are $5 along with FREE open play--bring your cards.

area: Board and Card Game Open Play
title: Board and Card Game Open Play
description: Open play for various games including Attack!, Star Trek Ascendancy, Pathfinder Card Game, Settlers of Catan, Macao, Puerto Rico, San Juan Card Game, Carcassonne, Ticket to Ride, Ticket to Ride: Rails and Sails, Lords of Waterdeep, Bang, and Joking Hazard Card Game

area: Gaming, Cosplay, Live Action Role Play
title: Sovereign Scrolls LARP
description: A Live action combat system that lets the players experience the action.

title: Monty Python and the Holy Quilt
description: A quilting bee with a medieval flare, we will be creating a quilt based on the classic "Monty Python and the Holy Grail"  All materials will be provided, just come and join the fun.  No moose or llamas will be harmed in the making of this quilt.

title: Foam Printmaking
description: Kids can print their very own postcards using hand drawn designs scratched into foam.

title: Epically Geeky Show LIVE
description: Come answer geeky questions as we do the show LIVE on YouTube!

title: Cosplay contest Prep
description: Learn what judges are looking for from two award-winning Cosplayers--Cosmic Empress and Nemesis Cosplay. Making a cosplay for fun is different than making one for a contest.  One wrong stitch can cost you the win!

title: Terrain craft 101
description: Come learn the basics of building your own tabletop gaming terrain!

title: Cosplay Ball
description: Kick off EGX by seeing and being seen--in costume of course! Enjoy DJ Kinect, along with bands The Returners: VGM and Space Corps.

title: Anime Q&A with Chuck Huber
description: Ask all! Hetalia, DBZ, Yu Yu, Soul Eater, Shin Chan, Sgt. Frog, etc...

title: Superfight
description: Play SUPERFIGHT, a game of absurd arguments! Players draw cards and use them to build absurd arguments on who would win a fight.

title: Kpop: a new break thru
description: Learn the history of kpop and how it's become the break through it is today.

title: Steampunk 101
description: An introduction to the Steampunk fan genre including music, literature and fashion.

title: Moving Wings 101: Take Flight
description: Learn how to make your own moving wings from the ground up, including making the feathers, back brace, piping, hooking up your actuators, best practices and where to buy your products.

title: No Budget Filmmaking
description: We understand the struggle that a beginning filmmaker may have. Come learn tips and tricks that will help elevate your film to a new level.

title: Paint & Take (Space Marine Armor)
description: Come join Adepticon-recognized painter Marcus Glowczak as he runs you through the basics of painting Space Marines & take home a free mini!

title: How to get a job in the industry (Prop Making, Costuming, Cosplay, etc.)
description: Come ask questions and learn from Carl Martin, former CTC student, now professional Prop Maker who runs his own studio, works as a fabricator for Volpin Props in Atlanta, and gets to create props and costumes for video game companies and movie productions!

title: ERAUGH! (A Demo of a Game of Political Mudslinging)
description: Have what it takes to be President? Prove it by lying about Fridayends and foes for fun and profit in this mad-cap game from NinjaHELL! Productions.

title: The Salty Hour - A Demonstration of Salty Bet
description: Salty Bet is an free online A.I vs A.I fighting game. Participants  place virtual bets of "Salty Bucks" on live competitive events.

title: Wild West Steampunk
description: A fun and engaging introduction to Wild West inspired Steampunk given by real Texas Steampunks! Learn how this thrilling chapter of the American West can inspire outlaws, gamblers, dancing girls, desperadoes and law men with a Steampunk Twist. From the use of spurs to where to find great deals on authentic western wear to Steampunk out this panel will cover all the fun prop and costuming opportunities of the Wild West.

area: The Comic Con community, inclusivity, tolerance
title: Fake Geek Girl: A discussion about the fear and loathing directed towards geek girls decried as fake
description: I would like to foster a discussion geared toward eradicating misogyny in what should be the most inclusive and safe place for women: the comic con.

title: Traditional vs. Digital Art
description: Keeping traditional art alive and appreciated in the age of digital art.

title: The Multiverse Community Built Steampunk Setting
description: A fun and informative overview of the Multiverse storyline concept developed by the Steampunk Community. Participants may ask questions about the cooperative story experience and how to become involved in the project, cooperating with thousands of other Steampunks across the US.

title: Rocky Horror Picture Show
description: Line forms at 9 (first come first served seating, with reserved seating for VIPs). Doors open at 9:30, Show starts at 10. Don't miss this cult classic, with a shadowcast from VLA in Killeen!

title: Vendor Hall and Artist Alley Open
description: Take your shopping list and shop vendors and artists!

title: Artist Dojo
description: A livestream of the drawing was projected on a large screen in Artist Alley for all Geekfest attendees to view.

title: Gaming
description: Underground Games will host single elimination revolving tournaments every 1.5 hours w/ prizes for Pokémon, Yugioh, Magic and Dragon Ball Super all weekend. The first entry is free, and subsequent entries are $5 along with FREE open play--bring your cards.

title: Console Gaming Tournaments
description: DragonBallZ, Killer Instinct and Super Smash Bros tournaments, $5 entry, top spot takes the pot. Sign up on site.

title: Crunchyroll
description: Playing episodes of random anime shows. Also accepting entries for anime drawing contest. Hand draw, digital and paintings.

title: Gastromagic! Molecular Gastronomy and the Magic of FOOD!
description: Hogwarts professors and a mad genius or two lead you in making your own snack magic.

area: Cosplay, Live Action Role Play, Outdoor Game
title: Cosplay Battle Chess
description: Prepare for war! Be a human chess piece and show us your moves in cosplay! Chess piece sign up at the event is first come, first served!

area: The Comic Con community, inclusivity, tolerance
title: Fake Geek Girl: A discussion about the fear and loathing directed towards geek girls decried as fake.
description: I would like to foster a discussion geared toward eradicating misogyny in what should be the most inclusive and safe place for women: the comic con.

title: Terrain Craft (Free Build)
description: Come in and build a small piece of terrain to take home!

title: D&D
description: Come play D&D! Various times & DM styles scheduled for the entire weekend! Kid Fridayendly tables available!

title: Swords & Wizardry and other games
description: Swords & Wizardry is an OGL "retro-clone" of the original fantasy roleplaying game created by Gary Gygax and Dave Arneson.

area: Gaming, Cosplay, Live Action Role Play
title: Sovereign Scrolls LARP
description: A Live action combat system that lets the players experience the action.

title: Kpop: a new break thru
description: Learn the history of kpop and how it's become the break through it is today.

title: Steampunk 101
description: An introduction to the Steampunk fan genre including music, literature and fashion.

title: Avengers: Infinity War
description: Iron Man, Thor, the Hulk and the rest of the Avengers unite to battle their most powerful enemy yet -- the evil Thanos. On a mission to collect all six Infinity Stones, Thanos plans to use the artifacts to inflict his twisted will on reality.

title: Prop Making 101 with Carl Martin, and
description: Come join master fabricator Carl Martin and learn where to find and how to use different materials to create amazing props and costumes!

title: Making True Change with Comics
description: Co-Creators of Evolution Revolutionaries Matt Live and Shannon Brewer discuss how comics are making a difference in the world today!

title: Console Gaming Tournaments
description: DragonBallZ, Killer Instinct and Super Smash Bros tournaments, $5 entry, top spot takes the pot. Sign up on site.

title: Introduction to Keyforge and open play.
description: An introduction to the game of Keyforge, where anything is possible.

title: Kobolds Ate My Baby
description: Play as a small, orange, furry creature that travels from the kobold lair in search of items, treasure, and most importantly: FOOD in a game created for EGX in 2016.

title: Intro to Medieval Dance
description: Members of the Society for Creative Anachronism, a historical reenactment group, will provide an introduction to Medieval Dance.

title: Monty Python and the Holy Quilt
description: A quilting bee with a medieval flare, we will be creating a quilt based on the classic "Monty Python and the Holy Grail"  All materials will be provided, just come and join the fun.  No moose or llamas will be harmed in the making of this quilt.

title: Foam Printmaking
description: Kids can print their very own postcards using hand drawn designs scratched into foam.

title: Hero’s Journey in Fantasy Fiction
description: Explore the hero’s cycle as it is seen in popular fantasy literature and films such as Harry Potter, Lord of the Rings, and other series.

title: Create Treasure out of Trash
description: Learn how to reuse everyday items and make new ones, or “upcycle” them into new treasures!

title: World Building for Fiction
description: A fun panel covering jow to develop a unique world setting for fiction, comics, art, or games. Q and A included."

title: Cosplay contest Prep
description: What are judges looking for?  When you make a cosplay for fun it's different than making one for a contest.  One wrong stitch can cost you the win!  How to approach a cosplay for contest and how to talk to the judges once the convention arrives.

area: Gaming, Making/Crafting, Arts (drawing/illustration, writing, film-making, performing)
title: Learn Basic Layering
description: Learn the basics of layering when painting minis & take home a free mini.

title: Anime Q&A with Chuck Huber
description: Ask all! Hetalia, DBZ, Yu Yu, Soul Eater, Shin Chan, Sgt. Frog, etc...

title: Watercolor and Color Pencil Techniques
description: Artist Andrea Meeks will share tips and tricks on watercolor and color pencil techniques.

title: Pathfinder 'We Be Goblins!'
description: Open Play sessions of Pathfinders 'We Be Goblins' adventure. All materials are provided. Some prizes to be awarded!

title: Scratch's Sc0re (Demo)
description: Build up your hand and try to end each round with more points than everyone else as you try out the new Gin Rummy variant from NinjaHELL! Productions.

title: Stitch in Time and Space
description: Try your hand on the sewing machine to make a variety of out of this world creations. Sew your own bags, book covers, dice, or sonic screwdriver holders!

title: Tea with McGonagall – Strength of Character
description: A good book (or movie) can't be great without the strength of its characters. From heroes to villains, defend your choice of the most pivotal character in the wizarding world.

title: Character creation
description: Workshop on developing a character for role playing, cosplay, writing for Steampunk. The panel covers thee core concepts of fictional character development in the form of fun group exercises that illustrate how, with a simple application of imagination, anyone can develop fun and interesting characters.

title: Q&A With Cosmic Empress
description: Open ended discussion on topics like: how to get into cosplay, where to buy cosplay, how to start making your own cosplay. What do you want to know?

title: Elements of Comics to Life
description: We would like to introduce the elements of bringing comics to life. The process of a writer, an illustrator, and cosplayer.

title: World Building
description: Learn how to create a campaign setting with a believable interactive experience.

title: Lip-sync For Your Life! - Cosplay Edition
description: Cosplayers!! The time has come.... For you to lip-sync for your LIFE!!!!!! The title says it all! Good luck and don't mess it up!

title: Superstitches
description: Sewing is incredible! Amaze your family and Fridayends with your superhero themed creations. Sew dice bags, pencil holders, capes, or other spectacular superhero themed handiworks.

title: Bring a little beading into your life
description: Follow along to create your own beaded hair comb.

title: World-Building
description: Great stories and characters need fantastic worlds to live in. How do masters of world building like Tolkien, Rowling, and Martin bring those rich world to life? How can you build spaces for your stories, gaming settings, and more.

title: Scanning Electron Microscope
description: The human eye can only distinguish two points with about 0.5 mm as the sizes of devices reduce we will need other techniques. SEM will help us.

title: The Multiverse Community Built Steampunk Setting
description: A fun and informative overview of the Multiverse storyline concept developed by the Steampunk Community. Participants may ask questions about the cooperative story experience and how to become involved in the project, cooperating with thousands of other Steampunks across the US.

title: Kid's Costume Contest
description: Don't miss seeing the cosplay skills of the younger set!

title: @hoop2inspire
description: See if you can spot a wandering basketball player spinning basketballs.

title: 3D printing for fun for Children and Adults
description: MECATX members will demonstrate 3D printing techniques and provide an introduction to 3D software, hardware and scanning techiques.

title: How to get a job in the industry (Prop Making, Costuming, Cosplay, etc.)
description: Come ask questions and learn from Carl Martin, former CTC student, now professional Prop Maker who runs his own studio, works as a fabricator for Volpin Props in Atlanta, and gets to create props and costumes for video game companies and movie productions!

title: Surviving In Someone Else's World
description: Author/comic creator, Shannon Brewer, teaches you the tricks to crafting the perfect fandom tribute in a way only you can.

area: Gaming, Making/Crafting, Arts (drawing/illustration, writing, film-making, performing)
title: Painting Carapace & Scales
description: Learn the basics on how to paint sci alien insectoids/ xenomorphs and fantasy Lizard Men from Games Workshop.

title: Stitches With Witches (and Wizards)
description: Even witches, wizards, elves, and other magical creatures sometimes use a machine to make their own wand holders, wing protectors, and more! Work a little technology magic, and design your own creation.

title: Books Vs. Movies: The Great Debate
description: From Hunger Games to Princess Bride to Harry Potter, some folks are just book people and some are just movie people. Each has pros and cons. Be ready to discuss your favorite and why it works better as a movie or a book.

title: Upcycling: Costuming for the Thrifty
description: An informative panel on how to make use of old clothing and items found at thrift stores in costume building, including an overview of what materials are worth buying and one aren't and Q&A.

title: The basics of becoming a Foamsmith
description: Learn the basic ways to make a fantasy weapon go from paper to 3D out of foam! Will also include tips what materials to use, where to get them and also on weathering your props to bring them to life!

title: Prop Making 102 with Carl Martin
description: Come join master fabricator Carl Martin and learn where to find and how to use different materials to create amazing props and costumes!

title: 3D Printing in Cosplay
description: Learn how 3D printing can help your cosplay to the next level!

title: Asylum
description: Asylum is an open sandbox horror-lite game presented during GeekFest 2016. Players wake up on an autopsy table in the basement of an old asylum with a bag of items and fend off attacks from the infection while they try to find a cure.

title: Learn the Art of Calligraphy
description: Learn the technique of Calligraphy and Illumination.

title: Gastromagic! Molecular Gastronomy and the Magic of FOOD!
description: Hogwarts professors and a mad genius or two lead you in making your own snack magic.

title: Fire Starters! Fast and Furious Story Creation
description: Ignite your stories, songs, animations, and more!  Here’s your chance to get started writing and creating with games, competitions, and more! You could even win your own story starting notebooks, pens, and more!

title: Steampunk Gaming
description: The hobby of gaming has always been an active interest in Steampunk. This panel covers the wide variety of Steampunk gaming products over time and the latest Steampunk games and products developed.

title: Coplay Handler 101
description: Are you in love with Cosplay, but not interested in dressing up? Grab a Fridayend or family member that is and become their handler. In this class we will cover the basics of what it is like being a Cosplay Handler. We will offer tips and advice that will help you both stay calm the day of an event!

title: Captain Planet – Create Your Own Super Hero
description: We will watch a few clips of the TV show and then the participants can color and draw a picture of their own super hero. Kids can choose what super powers they want their Super Hero to have to help save the planet and then share with the group.

title: Cynthia Lee Performance
description: She stole our heart last year, and is back for a repeat performance of her CuCu style!

title: Wanna Start a Band?
description: Learn how The Returners developed their style and what they learned along the way.

title: Batman Miniature Game
description: Play the Knight Models' Batman Miniature Game with an assortment of iconic DC heroes and villains.

title: Villainous: Making Your Bad Guys Really Bad
description: What makes a really good villain? Meet famous fictional villains, discuss what makes them “bad,” and develop your own villain for your games, stories, and more!

title: Your cosplay hobby could be a way to help your community!
description: Our cause-players alliance group will discuss with attendees how we have taken our cosplay hobby and used it to help local charities and the community.

title: No Budget Filmmaking
description: We understand the struggle that a beginning filmmaker may have. Come learn tips and tricks that will help elevate your film to a new level.

title: Maid: The RPG
description: Play as an anime maid in a crazy and random anime mansion and world. Anything can happen!

title: Villains in Fiction: One to Rule Them All
description: Voldemort, Sauron, Moriarty, Darth Vader, the Lannisters. Who is the best villain in literature, games, television, and movies?  Present your case or vote for the biggest “bad” of them all.

title: Adult Costume Contest
description: You've seen them around, now see them compete. The competition is always FIERCE!

title: Traditional vs. Digital Art
description: Keeping traditional art alive and appreciated in the age of digital art.

title: Cards Against Humanity Tournament
description: Play the party game that rewards your sick sense of humor and encourages you to be politically incorrect.

title: The Salty Hour - A Demonstration of Salty Bet
description: SaltyBet is an free online A.I vs A.I fighting game. Participants  place virtual bets of "Salty Bucks" on live competitive events.

title: Cosplay Dating Game
description: It's back! Get ready for a game of faux-matchmaking with a plethora characters from different fandoms. Contestants must answer in character!

title: Wild West Steampunk
description: A fun and engaging introduction to Wild West inspired Steampunk given by real Texas Steampunks!From the use of spurs to where to find great deals on authentic western wear to Steampunk out this panel will cover all the fun prop and costuming opportunities of the Wild West.

title: Sexy/ Lewd/Adult cosplay and its influence on the community.
description: A discussion and history of where cosplay has been, where it is at, where it is going. Addressing an open discussing the common usage of the term cosplay in society and how it might positively or negative effect a cosplayer now.   Analysis of  cosplay, my experiences in the community, and some fun relevant examples from my Instagram.

title: Live Geeky Music!
description: Experience live performances by our EGX bands, The Returners-VGM and Space Corps in the dome! What could be better?

title: The Fridaynge (late night)
description: Strap on your tinfoil and hold on. The truth is a little bumpy at times...and everything you've been taught is a lie!  Building 7, back and to the left, crisis actors, HAARP...if you know, come join me...if you don't, come get your red pill.

title: Your cosplay hobby could be a way to help your community!
description: Our cause-players alliance group will discuss with attendees how we have taken our cosplay hobby and used it to help local charities and the community.

title: 40th Anniversary: Monty Python & The Holy Grail
description: When the mythical king of the Britons leads his knights on a quest for the Holy Grail, they face a wide array of hilarious horrors.

title: D&D
description: Come play D&D! Various times & DM styles scheduled for the entire weekend! Kid Fridayendly tables available!

title: D&D (ages 8-14)
description: Come join DM Tony Ezzell as he guides wee adventurers through a 3-4 hour Scooby-Doo style dungeon romp! Includes a free pre-painted mini to take home!

title: Gaming by Underground Games
description: Underground Games will host single elimination revolving tournaments every 1.5 hours w/ prizes for Pokémon, Yugioh, Magic and Dragon Ball Super all weekend. The first entry is free, and subsequent entries are $5 along with FREE open play--bring your cards.

title: Sovereign Scrolls LARP

title: X-Wing Open Play
description: Assemble a squadron of iconic starfighters from across the Star Wars saga and engage in fast-paced, high-stakes space combat with iconic pilots such as Luke Skywalker and Darth Vader.

description: Playing episodes of random anime shows. Also accepting entries for anime drawing contest. Hand draw, digital and paintings.

title: Advanced cosplay
description: Dress making: Careful examination of what it takes to make high end dresses.  A start to finish example of Cosmic Empress' winning Neo Queen serenity dress.

description: Members of the Society for Creative Anachronism, a historical reenactment group, will provide an introduction to Medieval Dance.

title: Elements of Comics to Life
description: An introduction to the elements of bringing comics to life, including the process of a writer, an illustrator, and cosplayer.

title: The Game's Afoot: Solve a Sherlock Holmes Mystery
description: Use your powers of deduction and adduction to solve a crime ALA Sherlock Holmes, Nancy Drew, and other famous detectives.

title: Robotics
description: Students will learn to build a basic robot during this hour-long workshop from Quantegy Learning, a STEM-training company focusing on students ages 7-18.

title: Steampunk 101
description: An introduction to the Steampunk fan genre including music, literature and fashion.

title: Wig cutting & Styling 101
description: Too scared to take a pair of scissors to your wig? Unsure of what products to use? Or perhaps you’re just curious to learn something new! Join me and learn some different techniques in cutting and styling your wigs to take your cosplay to the next level!

title: Bring a little beading into your life
description: Follow along to create your own beaded hair comb.

title: The EGX Factor
description: Much like the hit TV show, The EGX Factor (formerly GeekFest’s Got Talent) is a chance for EGX goers to showcase their talents.

title: Daniel G. Benes Science Shows
description: Enjoy an amazing old-school and state-of-the-art demonstrations of physics, chemistry, and hair-raising, high-voltage electrical magic combined with working museum-quality scientific antiques, audience participation, and old-fashioned showmanship for some serious scientific fun!

title: Voice Acting Panel with Chuck Hüber
description: Ever wanted to voice act? Learn about the ins and outs, plentiful beginner tips, and an awesome experience hosted by Chuck Hüber!

title: Learn to Paint Unnatural Skin
description: Learn the basic of painting unnatural skin on miniatures & take your creation home!

description: Build up your hand and try to end each round with more points than everyone else as you try out the new Gin Rummy variant from NinjaHELL! Productions.

description: Kids look at the science of “whodunit” as you solve a crime with facts, evidence, and timelines. Parents and adults interested in forensic science are welcome.

description: We will watch a few clips of the TV show and then the participants can color and draw a picture of their own super hero. Kids can choose what super powers they want their Super Hero to have to help save the planet and then share with the group.

description: This Q&A is for BNHA fans who want to ask heroes or villains a question.

description: Hogwarts professors and a mad genius or two lead you in making your own snack magic.

description: Learn how to reuse everyday items and make new ones, or “upcycle” them into new treasures!

title: The Incredibles
description: Everyone’s favorite family of superheroes is back in “Incredibles 2” – but this time Helen is in the spotlight, leaving Bob at home with Violet  and Dash to navigate the day-to-day heroics of “normal” life.

title: Batman Miniature Game
description: Play the Knight Models' Batman Miniature Game with an assortment of iconic DC heroes and villains.

title: Cosplay Hollywood Squares
description: Making a return to stardom with cosplayers answering in character within a classic twist of Tic-Tac-Toe!

title: Tea with McGonagall – Strength of Character
description: A good book (or movie) can't be great without the strength of its characters. From heroes to villains, defend your choice of the most pivotal character in the wizarding world

description: An informative panel on how to make use of old clothing and items found at thrift stores in costume building, including an overview of what materials are worth buying and one aren't and Q&A.

title: Learn the Art of Calligraphy
description: Learn the technique of Calligraphy and Illumination.

title: EGX Finale: Comic Jam Reveal, Contest Award Winners
description: Don't miss our EGX finale where we unveil the Comic Jam YOU created, award our art contest winners and recognize the winners of our Cosplay and EGX contests!

title: How to Program Video Games
description: We will start with a basic structure of code where the students will fill in and customize pieces of code.

title: the art of drag kings
description: showing some of the procedures and the process on how women all around the world become men every day for performing or for personal gratification.

title: Lightsabers Academy Training
description: Participants ages 4+ learn life skills like confidence, self control, etc. through basic movements with a lightsaber.

title: Lightsabers Academy Training
description: Participants ages 4+ learn life skills like confidence, self control, etc. through basic movements with a lightsaber.
